title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.3-4 | 29-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhigaura Bhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasaam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be talking about the process of getting rid of the ego.
We will be discussing from the third verse of the eighth chapter of the first canto of
Srimad Bhagavatam.
The third verse is as follows.
Tatrasenam Kurupatim Dhritarashtram Sahanujam Gandharim Putrashokartam Pratham Krishnam
Chamadhavaha
The meaning of this third verse of the eighth chapter of the first canto of
Bhagavatam.
There sat the king of the Kurus Maharaj Yudhishthira along with his younger brothers and Dhritarashtra
Gandhari, Kunti and Draupadi all overwhelmed with grief.
Lord Krishna was also there.
Now Srila Prabhupada explains this situation that
the in the purpose of the third verse of the eighth chapter of the eighth chapter of the
ninth chapter of the third chapter Ganga Mahaprabha talks about the battle
of Omneshwarinha in Kurukshetra as we read about in her report.
Srila Prabhupada says that the battle of Kurukshetra was fought between family members and thus
all affected persons were also family members like Maharaj Yudhishthira and brothers Kunti,
Draupadi, Subhadra and Dhritarashtra and Gandhari.
Her daughters in laws were on one side with Kauravas and on the other side there were
So, therefore, the description given by Srila Prabhupada here is, all the principal dead bodies were in some way or other related with each other. And therefore, the family grief was combined.

They had lost all different grades of relatives. This is described in the Bhagavad Gita in the beginning also. When Arjuna is surveying the battlefield against whom he has to fight, the enemy party, he sees all grades of relatives on the enemy side.
Of course, on his side also there were relatives. But he is seeing the enemy side. There are so many grades of relatives.
And he is overjoyed.

And he is overjoyed with compassion for them. And he refuses to fight. And then Krishna instructs him in the Bhagavad Gita and tells him how he has to do his duty of fighting in this Dharma Yudha as a Kshatriya.
So, after the battle, the family grief of the surviving family members on both sides, the grief was combined.
Lord Krishna was also one of them as a cousin of the Pandavas and nephew of Kunti as well as brother of Subhadra, etc.
See how Krishna is related in so many ways. He is the nephew of Kunti. He is a cousin of the Pandavas. He is the brother of Subhadra.
Subhadra was the wife of Abhimanyu. Abhimanyu was the son of Arjuna. Abhimanyu died in the battle.
So, Subhadra was...
was...
lost her husband.
Abhimanyu.
I am sorry. I am sorry.
Subhadra lost her son, Abhimanyu, not her husband.
Subhadra's husband was Arjuna.
Arjuna and Subhadra's son was Abhimanyu. Abhimanyu died in the battle.
So, Subhadra lost her son, Abhimanyu.
So, Krishna was...
the brother of Subhadra.
The Lord...
Who is the Lord? The Lord... Supreme Lord Krishna.
Therefore, he was equally sympathetic toward all of them and therefore he began to pacify them befittingly.
Now, Krishna...
He is Supreme Lord.
So,
he is
actually sympathetic to all of them because
the Pandavas especially and Kunti and Draupadi were his devotees.
And, otherwise also, Krishna is the best well-wisher of every living being.
So, Krishna,
understandably, he began to pacify all the
family members who were in grief due to losing their beloved relatives.
And, the fourth verse...
The meaning of this verse is...
Citing the stringent laws of the Almighty and their reactions upon living beings,
Lord Sri Krishna and the Munis began to pacify those who were shocked and affected.
And, the fourth verse...
The Lord...
This is very important that when there is some natural calamity or some unfortunate incident
where there is a loss of life and that too a big number of people are killed,
then the only way to pacify the surviving family members is...
The only way to pacify the surviving family members is...
The only way to pacify the surviving family members is...
By the...
By the instructions and the spiritual discourses given by saintly persons, sages,
given by the devotees, by the saintly persons.
So, exactly that is the meaning of this verse.
So, exactly that is the meaning of this verse.
So, exactly that is the meaning of this verse.
So, exactly that is the meaning of this verse.
So, exactly that is the meaning of this verse.
So, exactly that is the meaning of this verse.

laws of nature under the order of the Supreme Personality of God it cannot be
altered by any living entity the laws of nature are something which nobody can
alter it nobody can alter it so therefore it is described here the
living entities are eternally under the subjugation of the Almighty Lord now who
is the maker of this laws it is Supreme Lord Krishna and who enforces it is
Supreme Lord enforces it and therefore everyone is eternally under the
subordinate control of the Supreme Lord who is the supreme control now it is
clearly explained here by Srila Prabhupada the Lord makes all the laws and orders
and these laws and orders are generally
called Dharma or religion this is a very very important point what is Dharma or
what is religion Dharma or religion means the laws given by the supreme law
nobody else can make these laws you cannot have your own religious system as
is fashionable nowadays no there is a universal religion or Dharma the
real Dharma that is the laws of God which is acting on every living being irrespective
of their belonging to some particular country or some religious sect or some belief system
all that doesn't matter just like when death comes there is no consideration of whether
this person is a Hindu or somebody is believing in God or somebody doesn't believe there is
no such consideration
when there is disease especially when there is a there's a epidemic or a
pandemic there is no consideration whether somebody believes or does not
believe these are laws stringent laws of material nature which are actually laws
of God so no one can create any religious formula bona fide religion is
to abide by the orders of the Lord
The Lord's orders are clearly declared in the Bhagavad Gita for all the scriptures
the most concise scripture is the Bhagavad Gita and all the scriptures by the
German BI known as Bible
krishna is directly spoken and given the orders everyone should follow krishna's orders
and that will make everyone happy simply by following krishna's orders as given the bhagavad
gita anyone can become happy in this world both materially and spiritually note this
it is not just spiritual happiness of course bhagavad gita is a spiritual literature but still
in the bhagavad gita how to be spiritually happy and also how to be materially happy both are
described as long as we are in the material world our duty is to follow the orders of the lord
that is our duty to simply follow krishna's orders as is given in the bhagavad gita
and if bhagavad
the grace of the lord we are liberated from the clutches of material world
then in our liberated stage also we can render transcendental loving service to the supreme lord
serving the lord is not some a temporary activity
no serving the lord is our eternal um engagement that's called uh swarupa that's called
swarupa so uh we agree to follow the orders of the supreme lord as given in
the bona fide scriptures or in bhagavad gita then we are protected by the lord we can be materially
and spiritually happy we can get liberation from material bondage and after liberation what happens
that's clearly told here we render transcendental loving service to the supreme lord and we are
transcendental loving service to the lord
in our material stage we can see neither ourselves nor the lord for want of spiritual vision
in our present condition we lack spiritual vision this vision is simply some
material vision which is not useful for seeing the spiritual reality we cannot see god we cannot
because god is completely spiritual in form and we cannot see our self the real self inside this body
we can't see anything spiritual
but when we are liberated from material affection
and when we are situated in the original spiritual form we can see both ourselves
and the lord face to face so therefore what is called as mukti or moksha or liberation
actually means to be reinstated in our original spiritual status after giving up the material
concept of life we are all having a material concept that i am this body all the bodily
connections are mine but we are not the body bodily connections are not mine
so to give up this material conception is to practice dharma
properly and become liberated from misconceptions material misconceptions
therefore human life is specifically meant for qualifying ourselves for the spiritual liberty
spiritual liberty real liberation is spiritual liberation materially however much people may
try to become free the bondage is always there and
because of the body and after this body is finished we don't die but we accept another
material body so if you want to become free from this material covering material trap
material entanglement then you should aim for spiritual liberation spiritual liberty
influence of the illusory energy or material energy we accept this spot life
of few years as permanent existence this is a big defect in our civilization
people do not know that this material world is a temporary place and it is
actually a presentation of illusion by the material energy now by cultivating
spiritual knowledge we can realize we are nothing to do with all this
material paraphernalia then as soon as we realize this I am nothing do with
this material body of material possessions of material existence itself
I become free from all material attachments and then this freedom from
material attachment means
ìˆ²
We understand who we are. We understand who is Krishna. We understand what is our relationship with Krishna. And we become reinstated in our spiritual original position.
Now, this chanting of Hare Krishna, it is actually the means to inject within the core of our heart the spiritual sound of the holy name of the Supreme Lord.
Thereby, it actually clears away misgivings, misconceptions. It clears away material misconceptions.
And then, it actually unlocks.
It awakens our spiritual knowledge within our heart, the spiritual knowledge. It is awakened.
So, the real problems of life, birth, death, disease, old age, these problems are solved only by cleansing the misgivings in the heart and by awakening to spiritual reality.
Through especially chanting Hare Krishna.
So, this is what is explained by Srila Prabhupada in his purport.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
